result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany A Keson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contributing to Truancy, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.45(1).
  • Contributing to Truancy, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.45(1).
  • Contributing to Truancy, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.45(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiffany A Keson in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM37, 16CM61 & 16CM64.

9:47 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM37:
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Count 3 - Guilty

16CM61:
Count 1 - Guilty

16CM64:
Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1, 2 & 3 on 16CM37 and Count 1 on 16CM61 and Count 1 of 16CM64 and Count 2 of 16CM64 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court accepts the statement of uncharged read-ins and states the read-ins on the record.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Halverson makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM37:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 5 day jail sentence - consecutive to 16CM61 and 16CM64 
Huber Priveleges with no electronic home monitor 
Placed on Probation for 3 years:
**Condition of Probation -
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample 
Comply with school attendance procedures
Comply with any open CHIPS Orders 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Probation to be transferred to Wood County 


Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 15 day jail sentence - consecutive to count 1 and any other sentences currently being served
Huber Priveleges with no electronic home monitor 
Placed on Probation for 3 years:
**Condition of Probation -
Probation can be transferred to Wood County 
Comply with conditions in Count 1 
Pay costs

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to count 1 & 2  and any other sentences currently being served
Huber Priveleges with no electronic home monitor 
Placed on Probation for 3 years:
**Condition of Probation -
Probation can be transferred to Wood County 
Comply with conditions in Count 1 & 2
Pay costs 

16CM61:
Count 1 - 
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to 16CM37
Huber Priveleges with no electronic home monitor 
Placed on Probation for 3 years:
**Condition of Probation -
Probation to be transferred to Wood County 
Comply with conditions in 16CM37
Pay costs 
Pay DNA Surcharge

16CM64:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 30 day jail sentence - consecutive to 16CM37 and 16CM61
Huber Priveleges with no electronic home monitor 
Placed on Probation for 3 years:
**Condition of Probation -
Probation to be transferred to Wood County 
Comply with conditions in 16CM37 and 16CM61
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 2 - DRI

**If probation is completed successfully (on all cases) and agent approves then State would not have an issue with early discharge from probation- after 18 months.

records.addlTxt:
Covers all files: 16CM37, 16CM61, 16CM64.
So long as the children are in school, comply with the school attendance procedures.

Defendant Tiffany A Keson in court with attorney Acalia N Halverson and only appointed on 16CM64 at this time. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 16CM37, 16CM61 & 16CM64

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a $1,000 signature bond to cover all files with conditions as stated.
Atty Halverson makes statements.

BY THE COURT:  $1,000 signature bond: Covers all files: 16CM37, 16CM61, 16CM64.
So long as the children are in school, comply with the school attendance procedures. 
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
